result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S. Pierson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew S. Pierson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew S. Pierson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
Anger management or other appropriate counseling as recommended by PO
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew S. Pierson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:44 p.m. Defendant Andrew S. Pierson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement to written offer made. Defendant in receipt of offer - accepts proposal by State. Michlig states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Defendant enters guilty plea. Right to counsel and waiver reviewed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. State/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
AODA Assessment and follow-through
Anger management or other appropriate counseling as recommended by PO.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given. Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Adj. 2:58 p.m.

3:33 p.m. Defendant Andrew S. Pierson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to proceed on own - Waiver free and voluntary - Defendant statement that he plans to take AODA assessment and follow-through. Schiek requests pre-trial conference to allow resolution. Adj. 3:38 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:27 p.m. Defendant Andrew S. Pierson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:29 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
